Reviews.Title: “a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: amna a
Reviews.Content: One would not think from the first glance at Biz Cevahir Hotel as 5 star hotel, but it really is in all standers deserves all the 5 stars and more. Location wise, all the interesting and historical places are within a walking distends; the neighborhood is very safe and quite but not dull. The level of hospitality shown by all the staff is incomparable. The staff smiles from their hearts and go out of their way to help the guests. Many thanks to all of the staff but especially thanks go to Serkin the front desk manger, Rihanna and Ahmet from restaurant who made us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Little Place”
Reviews.Author: GooseNYC
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous little hotel near the Blue Mosque. It's easy to get around the city from this location, and the hotel had everything we needed. I highly recommend a terrace room - the views are worth the extra expense. The only sad part was when it was pouring rain we couldn't go outside and use it. It's nice that the hotel was around the corner from all the restaurants instead of right on top of them. It's a cute place to stay in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: murgatr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights after disembarking from our cruise. Rooms were very clean & spacious according to European standards. Love the marble bathrooms. Breakfast & internet access were included. Short walk up hill to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar & trams that take you across Galata Bridge to Taksim Square. Staff were very friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central localed nice small hotel, with good service and spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: anonymusBiker
Reviews.Content: A small and modern furnished hotel centrally located near the Sultan-Ahmed-Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Good service everywhere within the hotel and quite well English communication possible. Adequate fresh breakfast with some Turkish delights. I have never sleep so quiet within a central located hotel. From the hotel to the airport you need approx. 75 minutes with public transportation (Metro and trolley), sidewalk included. 4 TL is an unbeatable price and the metro terminals are within the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location ans style.”
Reviews.Author: Suzipete
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here at the end of our Stay in Turkey. Arriving very late from Gallipoli the staff were very accommodating and helpful. the room was small but perfect, the only compromise was a queen bed and we are used to a king size. Ideal location, superb refurb and excellent for travelers wanting just that bit more from a hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Aweome”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: My stay at Biz Cevahir was nothing short of excellent. The staff were so attentive and friendly making our stay feel more like home than a hotel. The location is steps away from the most famous sites in the heart of Sultanamed. I love the small boutique hotel feel and the superior attention to detail that exists from the moment you walk in the door to the lovely breakfast room with delicious choices on the buffet. Thank you Merve, the hotel manager, Ahmed and staff for a wonderful stay. Dr. Stolarz

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: k G
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at the Biz Cevahir. We felt that our trip got off on the right foot by utilizing the hotel's transfer service from the airport. We have gotten scammed by taxi drivers in the past and it was a relief not to have to worry about this. The rooms were a little small but very warm and comfortable. The location was absolutely perfect and the hotel staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Vasilisa A
Reviews.Content: Incredibly attentive personnel, beautiful rooms, splendid breakfast, great location! Best service I've ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Michaelwillsturner
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at more expensive hotels in Istanbul in the past but fancied a different area this time. This had great reviews so thought I would take a punt. I was not disappointed. From the moment I walked in the door I was made to feel welcome. The concierge drew on a map places of interest nearby. We arrived late and the nearest resturant frequented by jimmy carter in the past as the owner proudly pointed out was good value. The hotel is a 5 min walk to the blue mosque so it is in a great location. From there you can hop on the tram to the metro and Istanbul is your oyster. Back to the hotel... The rooms are great... Check out the mood lighting. Breakfasts have everything to fill you up for a days sight seeing. It has a chic and classy feel all. Combined with the massively helpful staff this must be one of the best value hotels in Istanbul. But don't tell anyone!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Jowebbe
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel! Very modern and well furnished - beautiful, comfortable rooms. Has the feel of a boutique hotel, with the personal, friendly service and with all the mod cons you need - check out the daily rug too!!! The hotel is in a really great location - perfect for the Blue Mosque and Ayasofya and in the heart of Sultanahmet. You can walk to the Grand Bazaar and Spice Bazaar for shopping and a good base to explore the whole of Istanbul. The staff and manager are really helpful and polite and I will definitely stay here for my next stay in Istanbul - I would definitely recommend this hotel, we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will spend my next vacation At Biz Cevahir Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rayan M
Reviews.Content: This hotel now is one of my best hotels and I recommend it to any one who going to stay at Istanbul specially at sultan ahmed region old city. It is a small hotel, but you feel as you are in your own home. Staff are friendly and helpfull. The location is perfect near the Blue Mosque, topkapi sarayi palace museum, and Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Dream Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoreyIrvington
Reviews.Content: Apparently, this hotel was recently renovated and it is impressive. The hotel appears to have spend significant money in creating rooms that would be showcased in Architectural Digest with unique lighted alcoves, wonderful use of color and the best of everything. Very well located, the hotel is easy walking distance from Blue Mosque, Aye Sophia, and about 1/2 mile from the Istanbul waterfront. The neighborhood in the evenings is quiet and quaint - great for sleeping and romance. An excellent full breakfast is provided. The staff are extremely helpful and accommodating. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Very Helpful Staff- What more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: Vinay S
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that we visited Istanbul and we had booked two rooms (with terrace) as we were here with our two boys. Were a little skeptical when saw the hotel for the first time, but the reception and other staff are great. The rooms are nice and the view perfect. We had rooms 133 and 134- probably the best rooms in the hotel with magnaficient views of the blue mosque and the water. The rates were a little steep, but this was new year eve booking. The breakfast was good, the hotel arranged the transport from the airport and the staff gave us valuable tips about the city and where to go. Will definitely recommend this and will certainly stay again here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: chardenhaag
Reviews.Content: You could not find a better location for this hotel. Charming little streets to wander on , very close to the Blue Mosque as well as the Grand Bazaar but not on a hectic noisy busy street. The desk clerk and all the staff took extra time with us. They must have spent 15 minutes going over the local map , how to get here and there. The only thing I would say is we were underwhelmed by one fish restaurant they reccomended. It was nice to have a shuttle to the restaurant in the rain, but the food was overpriced for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Biz Cevahir Hotel (December 2011)”
Reviews.Author: FVC_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location and the service is superb. There are many restaurants and attractions in the area and if one needs to go further afield, the tram stop is a sort walk from the hotel. For a comparison, I walked to the Four Seasons Hotel (very close) and looked at their tarriff schedule. The rates at the Biz Cevahir are not cheap but compared to the Four Seasons, you get a very high quality room at an affordable rate. I assume those folks reading this review are not into the hostel scene. Our room was #134 which had a large balcony and excellent view of the Blue Mosque and the water. The quality of the room/bathroom fixtures are top notch. The breakfast was very good. Not outstanding but there was a lot of variety and tasty. The staff was quite helpful. We had a early morning depature and the staff prepared an early (5 am) breakfast and had the van waiting to take us to the airport. This hotel rates a 4+. Would I return....absolutely! Stayed 4 nights December 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: steppenw0lfe
Reviews.Content: Location is everything- the hotel is a few minutes from the Blue Mosque, Haiya Sophia, loads of shops, restaurants and cafes are within five minutes walking distance. Behind is also the Four Seasons. The service is excellent, reception does everything they can to make you feel comfortable and I was greeted very well from the moment I stepped out of the taxi. The rooms are small and the hotel doesn't have facilities like a pool etc but it's still a very good hotel catered for those who want to enjoy the city more than to lounge around in a hotel. It's also abit pricey (130 Euros per night in July) for its size, but it makes up for it in location.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very helpful and attentive. Your needs are immediately taken care of and their knowledge of the area is extensive.”
Reviews.Author: subbag
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay. The staff always inquired if we were enjoying our visit and did we need anything. The location was perfect for visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “I would return here”
Reviews.Author: JDG500
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 days in Istanbul staying at this hotel and if I were to return to Istanbul, I would stay there again. Our hotel room was very comfortable, well equipped and clean. Nice shower too. We had free wi-fi in the room which worked efficiently (Some hotels still use a plug-in cable for internet which is a bit of a problem with iPads, iPhones etc.) The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is very good. Walking distance to most of the sites. A bit further to the bazaar but close enough. Our room had good double glazing so the sound of the call from the mosques was not a problem. Good selection of restaurants in the neighbourhood, although these were firmly geared for the tourists. Locals seem to eat on the Galata tower/Taxim Square side. Price was not cheap but seemed to be comparable to other similar hotels in the city. I am probably sounding like the owner writing his own review but assure you that that is not the case. I would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MauroSav
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to the major attractions and tram stop. Hotel is brand new, modern and well managed. Staff is friendly, professional and helpfull (Serkan is very kind). Room is comfortable and clean. Bathroom and shower were great. Breakfast could be improved, but it's ok. i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: IvanMend
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in the heart of old Istambul. The location is perfect, less than 5 minutes from Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofya, etc, etc. Rooms are clean and well decorated, I personally recommend the ones with terrace, the views are incredible. All the staff is really nice and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SetianDim
Reviews.Content: Biz Cevahir is an excellent hotel, from all points of view. Located very close to all historical places of Sultanahmet area, (Agia Sophia, Top Kapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar), the rooms are very comfortable and clean. We booked a triple room and they had shown us two different types of rooms so that we could select the most appropriate for our needs. The staff of the hotel offerred high level services whenever we needed their help. I recommend this hotel to everyone who plan to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Your private retreat”
Reviews.Author: smollaian
Reviews.Content: So happy with location, service and ambiance. Not jelous that I am not staying at 4 seasons (which is next door) Many thanks to our host Serkan

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: elsa c
Reviews.Content: The reception staff is extremely helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect, in a very historical area of Istanbul. The rooms are clean and not noisy at all! Breakfast is also perfect with its fresh foods and drinks. I hope to come back again and i can recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabriel s
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent with its helpful staff and its location. It is located in the center of Istanbul. The rooms were really clean and comfortable. The breakfast was perfect too, you can find whatever you want to eat. I can highly recommend this hotel to everyone. If I visit Istanbul again, I will definitely stay in Biz Cevahir Hotel Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Near all the sites”
Reviews.Author: newyorker021
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel in the old city, near all the sites that we wanted to see in Istanbul. The staff was very helpful--they arranged to pick us up at the airport and got us a guide to the city. The hotel itself is new and very clean and bright--including the bathrooms. It is around the corner from the Four Seasons and yet a lot less expensive. We had a beautiful room with a balcony on which one could see the Blue Mosque. There was no fitness center or pool, but we walked a lot. The one negative comment is the breakfast, which was just okay; it is served downstairs in an area with just a little natural light (in contrast to the lobby, which is lovely). in addition, the coffee choice was either Nescafe or Turkish coffee (or tea) so for those who like really good drip coffee, that was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ThegilaniAK
Reviews.Content: The staff is very very friendly. The will introduce you to the Sultanahmet area (where the hotel is located) on a map on arrival, along with the city's attractions. The bath is very clean and sanitized for the visitor. One thing though, make sure you leave your extra room access card in the electric switch slot when leaving to keep the AC working during the peak of summer heat otherwise you will be back to a warm room. The furniture of the room is good, but not luxeriouse. The breakfast is, though basic, good.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and confortable”
Reviews.Author: Ipho
Reviews.Content: Charmy hotel, ideal for some relaxing hours after visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with a Special Touch”
Reviews.Author: Ramon_Fretz
Reviews.Content: The Biz Cevahir Hotel is a very modern boutique hotel just at the heart of Sultanamet, steps from the Haya Sofya, the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque or Istanbul's largest Bazar. The hotel has nice, comfortable and well appointed rooms with all necessary amenities and a spacy bathrooms. Everything is spotlessly clean. Some rooms face the streets, some go to the back. Ask for those facing the street if you want to open windows and do not prefer a solely air-conditioned environment. The rooms to the street can sometimes be loud when garbage collection comes at very early morning hours (if windows are open). If windows are closed, sound is kept outside. The rooms to the inside are very quiet. Breakfast is served in the basement but in a well lit and decorated room. It is rich but caters more for the Eastern traveller. Many restaurants and cafÃ©s can be found close to the hotel, good shopping opportunities as well as departure points to the Bosphorus tours. The airport (AtatÃ¼rk International) is only about 20-25 minutes away and easy accessible by taxi. This hotel is excellent value for money and it has one particular asset: its people. Attentive to your every detail, friendly, smiling and well informed. We can only recommend this hotel to couples and friends travelling together and looking for a high quality and well located accommodation in the centre. I would definitely go back and can only reconfirm other reviews I have read in TripAdvisor. It is because of these that we chose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place , friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo_AUS
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I , stayed there for 4 days whilst in Istanbul , the hotel was very central to all the main attractions , it was very clean and staff was very friendly and professional , why stay anywhere else ?

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and recommend it”
Reviews.Author: stefan098
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, very friendly staff, nice breakfast, good bed, clean and nice bathroom. The location is just the best, close to a lot of nice restaurants and tourist attractions, but also in a very quit street.

Reviews.Title: “A charming small hotel with lovely staff. Highly recommendable.”
Reviews.Author: Lucyqua
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly located behind Sultan Ahmet Square, literally 3 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. It is very well run, I found everything in perfect working order with modern fixtures, comfy room and bed, very clean. The staff is ever so nice, respectfully friendly, will go out of their way to help. They don't have a restaurant but there are lots of small restaurants nearby, so no problem at all in finding a good place to dine. Breakfast, although it was OK for me, could do with a bit more variety. I felt so comfortable and pampered in this hotel that if I ever go back to Istanbul, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieSing123
Reviews.Content: I chose the Biz Cevahir Hotel based on the feedback of other guests on Tripadvisor. I'm glad I took their advice! We could not have stayed at a nicer place. The location is in the old area and within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia & Topkapi Palace. The area is also filled with lovely sidewalk (and rooftop) cafes. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. There are only about 20 rooms, so service is personalised without being in your face. The service and friendliness of the hotel team is great, from the manager, Merve, to Serkan, the front desk guy, to the housekeeping staff and bellboy. I would highly recommend this hotel and gladly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay......”
Reviews.Author: muni85
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location. A walking distance to the main sights - Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia , Topkapi Palace, museum and Araasta Bazaar. Our aged father loved all the walks. The hotel is chic with modern concept , free wifi and good elevator. Breakfast was served in a cheerful ambience. We were given a spacious room while our father was given a smaller room with disabled-friendly toilet. He liked the room except for the faux window. The hotel is just a block away from the Seven Hills rooftop restaurant and it is opposite The Meathouse restaurant ( the fish was superb). Definitely, we had made the right choice what more with all the helpful staffs making our holiday the best so far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , friendly staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: feri303
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very chic and a trendy boutique hotel. The room was very clean and spacious. The decor is very cheerful. Loved the shower with a big rainforest head. Very friendly and helpful staff, especially Serkan and Seray. Both were always polite and always making sure we are comfortable. They also made sure that we were able to get the most from our touring - and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities. Modern and clean.”
Reviews.Author: pattycakie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for the couple nights we stayed in Istanbul. It was centrally located in the Old City, and less than a 5 minute walk to the Hagia Sophia and a lot of other sites, 10 minutes to the Bazaar, and easily accessible by tram to anywhere else including Taksim. If you take a taxi, be sure to say Biz Cevahir in Sultanahmet (Old City) next to the Four Seasons Hotel. We were taken to another hotel called Grand Cevahir once and it cost us! Our room was very clean with modern decor, and nice sheets on the bed. Although the mattress itself was a little hard. Overall, it was a great value for a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “east meets west at this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: monsita1910
Reviews.Content: if you want to stay in an architectural gem, then biz cevahir is it. it is sheer pleasure just to be in this boutique hotel where modern architecture is met by ottoman details. it is comfortable, best location, walking distance to everything, professional attention, impeccable service, and did i mention gorgeous place and a great value for the money. i certainly recommend it and will stay there any time i am back in istanbul, which by the way, is an amazing city. monsita1910

Reviews.Title: “Biz Cevahir - A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Rizza36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Istanbul and a week long stay at the Biz Cevahir. I must say we were very please with the hotel, the staff and the amenities. I will give a quick breakdown of what we loved about the hotel. Location - The drive in from the airport (which was also arranged by the Biz) was excellent, great service, spacious car and comfortable ride. Driving through the neighborhood on our initial trip in was probably one of the best experiences. The sun was setting over the blue mosque and the neighborhood was just so charming with the little shops and restaurants. Upon check in Serkan was very polite and welcomed us and our baggage was taken to our room (room 134 with terrace and great view of blue mosque) The hotel is located very nicely, walking distance to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Topkapi Palace and the tram. There is no shortage of restaurants and cafes as well as the arasta bazaar (buy your souveneirs here not Grand Bazaar!) . The room itself was quit comfortable, good closet space, mini bar, nice safe to lock valuables, bathroom and shower were nice and clean. Loved the waterfall showerhead. The Biz Cevahir is very modern and it is a beautiful boutique hotel. Wifi was always great, breakfast was always good as well, plenty of food and great orange juice! Elevator was never a problem. Overall I must say we are very pleased with this hotel and if we ever return to Turkey we will be sure to stay here again as well as send our friends and family. Lastly, I know there is no shortage of hotels in Istanbul that offer the same amenities. Trust me when I stay the staff here makes a huge difference. Serkan and Yesar and the other young lady (sorry I forgot her name!) went out of there way to help us plan trips and tours. They told us what to see and how to get there and most importantly they were very welcoming and we were able to joke around with them and have a good time. My wife and I we're very sad leaving this morning as we had grown to love this place in only a week. Luckily we were able to snap a picture with Serkan for our photo album. Don't hesitate with the shortage of reviews, trust me this hotel will make your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazed by this hotel. Perfect location, super clean and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KeesdeKoning
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:00 but we could check in directly. We where amazed by the modern, super clean hotel. We really enjoyed our stay at the Biz Cevahir Hotel. The breakfast is very, very good. Healty, but also nice mini hotdogs and croussants. The staff was just amazing. They helped me with everything. Wifi connection is 100%, stable and fast. We defenitly want to come back to this room.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and location for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Marwandr
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure staying in this hotel, I have stayed in multiple hotels in Istanbul this was the best with no doubt, clean, stylish and reasonably spacious room, helpful and smiling staff, fairly new building (few months old!), located just 2-3 minutes walk from sultan ahmet (located in the middle between hagia sofia museum and sultan ahmed jami), you will not find similar facility with this location for this cost !! Breakfast was healthy and balanced, easy access to metro station to reach any site in entire Istanbul, I will stay their again in future trips to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, modern: what more do you want !”
Reviews.Author: HPDubai
Reviews.Content: An excellent newly build hotel in a very good location. Ultra modern fit out of the rooms. Comfortable beds. Friendly staff. For the amount they charge this is very good value for money. Good breakfast. If they would also provide Turkish bread at breakfast everything would be perfect.

HotelInfo.Name: Biz Cevahir Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cankurtaran mh. Kutlugun Sk. No:8 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
